availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
State of New Jersey
Essex County } ss.

I James F. Bond residing in the City of Newark County and State aforesaid, appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky a commissioner to take the proof and acknowledgement of Deeds and other instruments and to administer oaths, to be used in said State of Kentucky, pursuant to the Laws thereof, do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully Execute and peform all the duties of such commission according to the best of my skill and understanding
Subscribed and sworn before me this 25th day of September A D 1862

Danl Hawes
Justice of the Supreme Court of New Jersey

New Jersey
Comr of Deeds
Oath
Jas F. Bond
Filed Sept 30th 1862
